title: The Romantic Era: Love as Suffering
description: A fast breakdown of The Romantic Era: Love as Suffering for builders.

hook.text: When Goethe published 'The Sorrows of Young Werther,' a wave of suicides followed across Europe.

buildup.text: Romantic poets glorified heartbreak. Byron, Shelley, and Keats wrote love as beautiful agony.

discovery.text: The idea that 'true love must hurt' entered Western culture during this period â€” and never fully left.

twist.text: Therapists today trace toxic relationship patterns to this era's belief that suffering proves love's depth.

climax.text: The Romantics gave us passion and poetry â€” but also the dangerous myth that love should destroy you.

punchline.text: The Romantics taught us love should hurt. We're still unlearning it.
